description: Dive into "Capturing Chiang Rai's Hidden Gems" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capturing Chiang Rai's Hidden Gems

places.generalDescription: Wat Huay Pla Kang is a temple complex located 6 km northwest of Chiang Rai city. It features a 9-floor pagoda with 12 surrounding structures and a giant statue of the bodhisattva Guan Yin, also known as the Goddess of Mercy. Despite being called 'Big Buddha,' it's not actually a Buddha statue. Visitors can climb to the highest level of the pagoda for stunning views over Chiang Rai by either using stairs or paying for an elevator ride.

sources.snippet: My favourite Chiang Rai temples were the White Temple, Blue Temple and Dragon Temple or otherwise known officially as Wat Rong Khun (white), Wat Rong Suea Ten (blue) and Wat Huay Pla Kang (dragon). I discovered a number of things along the way and so I am sharing some practical tips on how to take photos at and visit Chiang Rai‚Äôs famous temples to help you when you visit as well.
sources.shortName: Practical tips for taking photos at the famous Chiang Rai temples - Sarah Adventuring
10 Best Photo Spots in Chiang Rai, Thailand

sources.snippet: Dominating Chiang Rai‚Äôs landscape with its towering stature, Wat Huay Pla Kang is an impressive statue about 25 meters tall. Also called the Big Buddha, smaller statues with intricate carvings surround the tower. Its serene atmosphere makes it a perfect place to end the day.
sources.shortName: Chiang Rai In Thailand |

places.name: ‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏î‡∏´‡πâ‡∏ß‡∏¢‡∏õ‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏±‡πâ‡∏á

reviews.text: The Buddha statue showcasing the artist's incredible skill.  Its sheer size commands attention, inspiring awe in all who behold it.  The craftsmanship is a testament to the rich artistic traditions. This magnificent work of art and the huge size have to be appreciated

The walk up the 9 Floor Pagoda was impressive and would recommend. You can get an amazing view from up there.
For the white statue, you can get an elevator for 100 Bhat, it was not worth it as the view is restricter and can get a better view from outside or from the Pagoda next door. Don't forget to get the free pink shuttle bus from the car park up to monument if you don't want to walk up the steep hill. Good for kids and the elderly.

Beautiful temples to visit,I really appreciated the experience on the statue in particular.
With 10 baht you can use the lift and go in the head of the statue where you got a great views of the temple and the surrounding area.
The internal of the statue is really well decorated aswell.
Another good experience!

places.address: 553, Ban Du, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Wat Rong Suea Ten, also known as the Blue Temple, is a modern Buddhist temple in Chiang Rai. It stands out with its striking sapphire blue exterior and intricate golden detailing. Visitors can explore this monumental temple as part of a day tour that includes other prominent temples such as the White Temple (Wat Rong Khun) and the Black House (Baandam Museum).

sources.snippet: My favourite Chiang Rai temples were the White Temple, Blue Temple and Dragon Temple or otherwise known officially as Wat Rong Khun (white), Wat Rong Suea Ten (blue) and Wat Huay Pla Kang (dragon). I discovered a number of things along the way and so I am sharing some practical tips on how to take photos at and visit Chiang Rai‚Äôs famous temples to help you when you visit as well.
sources.shortName: Practical tips for taking photos at the famous Chiang Rai temples - Sarah Adventuring

sources.snippet: Also called the Blue Temple because of its bright blue facade, Wat Rong Suea Ten should also be a must on your list of places to see in Chiang Rai.
sources.shortName: Chiang Rai In Thailand |

sources.snippet: Popular Attractions: Wat Rong Khun - White Temple, Wat Rong Suea Ten (Blue Temple), Baan Dam Museum, Singha Park Chiang Rai, Long Neck Village
sources.shortName: Chiang Rai Pictures - Chiang Rai Travel Photos

sources.snippet: After the White Temple, let‚Äôs now discover the Blue Temple, probably the 2nd most popular tourist attraction in Chiang Rai.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Things to do in Chiang Rai | + My best tips

places.name: Rong Suea Ten Temple

reviews.text:
You definitely won't miss this temple. The vibrant blue color is incredibly striking. But what truly caught my attention was the wall art, especially the detailed paintings depicting the life story of Sakyamuni Buddha. The artwork is beautiful and full of meaning.

No entrance fee. Proper attire is required to enter, but no worries as they provide sarongs. There's some ongoing renovation and construction, so hopefully there'll be even more to see in the future.

Really nice, different from the other temples. If you stay in Chiang Mai is in walking distance to visit. If you take a guided tour, then it's always included in the tour so you might as well not do it separately.  Tour is better. The link between the blue and the white temple, the blue temple is designed but a student of the artist who designed the white temple. It's a must see. Also, don't miss on the small museum collection.

This place is absolutely gorgeous! Such a wonderful temple! They don't charge any fees, is only donation based. The amount of details is impressive. Don't skip the museum behind, it has the story of the temple and many important objects including and amazing miniature of the complex. It's definitely a must visit in Chiang Rai.

places.address: 306 ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏π‡πà‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà 2 Maekok Rd, Tambon Rim Kok, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Wat Rong Khun, also known as the White Temple, is a contemporary Buddhist temple located in Chiang Rai, Thailand. Designed by artist Chalermchai Kositpipat, it features a unique white exterior with intricate designs and unconventional architecture. Inside, visitors can explore unusual murals and decorations along with odd sculptures. The temple aims to provide a space for learning and meditation to promote the teachings of Buddhism.

sources.snippet: No trip to Chiang Rai is complete without seeing its most famous attraction ‚Äì the White Temple, officially ‚ÄúWat Rong Khun‚Äù. Recognized for its white fa√ßade made of mirror shards and lime that gleams beautifully on a sunny day, the White Temple is among the most famous sights of Northern Thailand. Follow the queue of visitors to get inside, where you‚Äôll find murals featuring Buddhist motifs and other thought-provoking designs.
sources.shortName: Chiang Rai In Thailand |

sources.snippet: The most spectacular and iconic of all the structures claimed by Chiang Rai, Wat Rong Khun is a jewel in the crown of the city. Due to its finely chiselled white structure that glistens like the moon, it is widely known as The White Temple. In 1997, the construction of the temple was completed and the complex was opened for visitors.
sources.shortName: 30 Places to Visit in Chiang Rai, Tourist Places & Attractions
10 Best Photo Spots in Chiang Rai, Thailand

sources.snippet: Wat Rong Khun, otherwise known as the White Temple, is probably the most visited Chiang Rai attraction. But not without good reason. Normally I like to stay away from the more touristy things to do but, in this case, I don‚Äôt think that rule applies.
sources.shortName: 7 Extra Special Chiang Rai Attractions

sources.snippet: But it‚Äôs more of a contemporary, unconventional museum than a temple. It is also privately owned by the popular Thai artist Chalermchai Kositpipat who also designed it. Now, how he got rich and famous is another story.
sources.shortName: 8 places in Chiang Rai you must not miss

sources.snippet: The area is home to pristine mountain villages, the beautiful Mekong River, as well as the world-famous White Temple (Wat Rong Khun) and Black Temple (Baan Dam).
sources.shortName: Chiang Rai Pictures - Chiang Rai Travel Photos

sources.snippet: Located 13 km south of Chiang Rai, it‚Äôs one of the most famous place to visit in Northern Thailand. You will see it on almost all postcards!
sources.shortName: 17 Best Things to do in Chiang Rai | + My best tips
Best Things to do in Chiang Rai, Thailand (+Photos)

places.name: Wat Rong Khun

reviews.text: This was my first time to visit this temple. Make sure you are wearing skirts down to the knee if you go there. The entry was 100B and it is worth it. It is truly unique. It focuses on death a lot in the beginning but changes throughout. The level of artistry is at a great level. Everything is very manicured and beautiful. It has on the temple grounds the most beautiful bathrooms you have ever seen. I recommend checking this temple out.

Really beautiful place, definitely worth a visit! We went during off season so it wasn't too busy, which made it even nicer to walk around. Entry was 100 baht per person (for tourists). They were quite strict about women covering up shoulders/knees to go inside, but totally worth it - the detail of the temple is incredible and unlike anything else we've seen in Thailand.

Beautiful temple. The white facade stands out and makes a mesmerizing sight. The complex is also much more than the temple and could be explored freely. Best to go in early to avoid the big crowds and the heat. The mix of contemporary and religious themes was a new experience.

places.address: Pa O Don Chai, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Wat Phra Kaew Chiang Rai, a 14th-century temple located in Mueang Chiang Rai district, is home to the revered Emerald Buddha, discovered on the temple grounds in 1434. Originally known as Wat Pa Ya or Wat Pa Yia, it was renamed in 1977 after the discovery of the Emerald Buddha image. The temple features a multi-faced ubosot built in 2433 and has undergone restoration over time.

sources.shortName: 10 Best Photo Spots in Chiang Rai, Thailand

places.name: ‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏î‡∏û‡∏£‡∏∞‡πÅ‡∏Å‡πâ‡∏ß

reviews.text: Really nice temple.. plenty of green, air feels very fresh here. Also not many tourists, quite relaxing. Walk up the steps and you will see a magnificent scene, green marble? walls. Recommended , one of the nicest ones in the area

A must visit if in Chiang Rai, the temples with their historical value, the museum is very interesting and so well set out. There are Buddhist meetings every Tuesday at 9.30 am where everyone is invited to join, and so interesting

Our visit to Wat Phra Kaew in Chiang Rai was a highlight of our trip, offering a perfect blend of history, spirituality, and stunning architecture! Located in the heart of the city near the Chiang Rai Night Bazaar, this temple is easily accessible yet feels like a serene retreat from the bustling streets. Known as the original home of the Emerald Buddha (now in Bangkok), Wat Phra Kaew holds immense cultural significance, and its peaceful ambiance made our visit unforgettable.

The temple complex is beautifully maintained, with lush gardens, intricate statues, and vibrant Lanna-style buildings adorned with red and gold details. The main hall houses a replica of the Emerald Buddha, crafted with exquisite detail, and the surrounding murals depicting Buddhist tales are mesmerizing. We were particularly drawn to the Phra Yok Museum on-site, which displays rare Lanna artifacts, including jade Buddha images and ancient scriptures.
a true gem in Chiang Rai that we'd highly recommend to anyone exploring the city!

places.address: 19 ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏π‡πà‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà 1 Trairat Rd, Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Walking Street Chiang Rai is a bustling market offering a wide range of experiences for visitors. From street-food stands to wooden carvings and batik clothing, the market is filled with options. In addition to shopping and dining, the street also features Thai spas, handcrafted products, folk concerts, and Thai dance shows. Local performers entertain on a mini stage while art and craft stalls showcase their wares.

sources.snippet: Topping the list of the most excellent tourist places in Chiang Rai ideal for spending an eventful evening with family and friends, Chiang Rai Walking Street is a busy market area. Throngs of visitors with all their energy and excitement create a happening atmosphere that is sure to cheer anyone up.
sources.shortName: 30 Places to Visit in Chiang Rai, Tourist Places & Attractions

places.name: Chiang Rai Walking Street

reviews.text:
10/10 - Vivid and joyful night market. You can see Thai style market and a lot of street food.
On that day, I saw northern Thai dancing group, so fun.
6/10 - So crowded. No parking space, just park near market area and walk.

Such a fun thing to do in Chiang Rai üòä
Just make sure you have your transport sorted. I loved the very interesting shops, the food and the vibe. Truly a community set-up. You can even dance to live music out in the open.

Chiang Rai Walking Street on Saturday nights is a vibrant feast for the senses! Tons of delicious local food and unique handmade goods from friendly vendors. A must-visit for a taste of local culture. Remember, parking is unavailable, so hop on public transport for easy access!

places.address: Thanalai, Tambon Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Wat Rong Khun, also known as the White Temple, is a unique and spectacular attraction in North Thailand. It serves as both a temple and an art gallery, featuring contemporary murals that offer thought-provoking scenes related to life, death, and human suffering. While the entrance fee is 100 baht, many visitors find it worth the price for the amazing experience. The temple's appearance surpasses its pictures and is considered a must-visit tourist spot.

sources.snippet: No trip to Chiang Rai is complete without seeing its most famous attraction ‚Äì the White Temple, officially ‚ÄúWat Rong Khun‚Äù. Recognized for its white fa√ßade made of mirror shards and lime that gleams beautifully on a sunny day, the White Temple is among the most famous sights of Northern Thailand. Follow the queue of visitors to get inside, where you‚Äôll find murals featuring Buddhist motifs and other thought-provoking designs.

places.name: Wat Rong Khun

reviews.text:
Amazing place, best temple I've ever seen..the detail is outstanding, and this place is well worth the trip..

Not many souvenirs there and bring sun glasses it does get bright with all the white and glass detail sparking

Don't forget it's a temple and there is a dress code..knees and shoulders have to be covered, so wear thin pants like elegant pants and a short sleeve shirt..it's hot!!

Places to eat across the street and other shops you can visit

This was my first time to visit this temple. Make sure you are wearing skirts down to the knee if you go there. The entry was 100B and it is worth it. It is truly unique. It focuses on death a lot in the beginning but changes throughout. The level of artistry is at a great level. Everything is very manicured and beautiful. It has on the temple grounds the most beautiful bathrooms you have ever seen. I recommend checking this temple out.

Beautiful temple. The white facade stands out and makes a mesmerizing sight. The complex is also much more than the temple and could be explored freely. Best to go in early to avoid the big crowds and the heat. The mix of contemporary and religious themes was a new experience.

places.address: Pa O Don Chai, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Wat Phra That Doi Chom Thong is a historic Buddhist temple in Chiang Rai, Thailand, featuring a golden pagoda that houses relics of the Buddha. The temple is part of the rich cultural and natural landscape of Chiang Rai, which includes landmarks like Wat Phra Kaeo and Wat Ming Mueang Temple, as well as parks such as Phu Chi Fa Forest Park and Singha Park.

sources.snippet: As a photographer who loves capturing unique things, visiting  Doi in Cee is one of my personal favourite things to do in Chiang Rai. It‚Äôs a temple complex that‚Äôs sat on top of a large hill overlooking the surrounding countryside. There are several temples and a number of very large statues of Buddha scattered around.
sources.shortName: 7 Extra Special Chiang Rai Attractions

places.name: Wat Phra That Doi Chom Thong

reviews.text: So peaceful and nice view at the sunset
Lovely little temple complex next to the City Pillar monument. The golden stupa is about 500  years old and is said to be built on the remains of an even older temple.

The original Wat was apparently older than the city, however the current buildings are much younger. We found the Wat relatively unspectacular, however its location slightly outside todays city centre on a hill made it worth the trip. Next to it is a monument designating the old centre of town (2nd photo)

places.address: WR8F+72M, ArjAmnuay Rd, Rop Wiang Sub-district, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Wat Ming Muang, a 700-year-old temple in Chiang Rai, is an ornate and colorful marvel that captivates visitors with its dazzling design. This ancient temple, built in 1262, serves as a memorial to Queen Chommuang, the mother of King Mengrai the Great. While not heavily visited by tourists, it holds great significance for locals and offers a calm and relaxing walkabout experience.

sources.shortName: 10 Best Photo Spots in Chiang Rai, Thailand

places.name: Wat Mung Muang

reviews.text: Biasly one of my all time favorite temple , very small in size yet give a proper sensation of the North .  Interesting view of Masjid from this temple as well

A beautiful hidden gem in Chiang Rai! I visited at sunset, and the golden light on the intricate Lanna-style architecture made the temple look even more stunning. It's peaceful, with detailed naga sculptures and impressive wood carvings. Unlike some of the more famous temples, this one is quiet and feels authentic.

Right in front of the temple is Kad Luang Market, a great spot to get local goods and street food. Wat Mung Muang is open daily from 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM-definitely worth a visit if you're in Chiang Rai!

BTW It is free for everyone.

A temple located relatively close to other buildings, and with vehicles parked close to the temple's outer walls. This made it difficult to take general photos of the temple itself, but it was great to be able to go inside and see the beautiful decoration.

Parking outside the temple can be difficult, so using motorbikes makes it a little easier in terms of parking, but it is always possible to park in the nearby areas.

places.address: 2415 Ruangnakron Rd, Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: The Chiang Rai Clock Tower is a stunning architectural masterpiece located in the heart of a traffic circle. Designed by renowned artist and architect Chalermchai Kositpipat, it bears resemblance to the iconic White Temple with its distinctive style. At night, the tower comes alive with colorful lights, creating a surreal environment.

sources.snippet: In the centre of Chiang Rai, there is a golden clock tower that acts as a roundabout the in middle of a crossroad. Every night at 19:00, 20:00 and 21:00 the clock springs into action and puts on a multimedia show that includes a light show, music and figurines moving around inside. It‚Äôs one of the more popular Chiang Rai attractions and worth going to see at least once.
sources.shortName: 7 Extra Special Chiang Rai Attractions

sources.snippet: Located in the heart of the city, this golden Clock Tower is simply spectacular and is probably the most majestic roundabout you‚Äôll see in Thailand. While traffic does shoot around it at all hours of the day, the clock is a splendid work of art and is rightfully one of the main tourist attractions in Chiang Rai.
sources.shortName: Best Things to do in Chiang Rai, Thailand (+Photos)
10 Best Photo Spots in Chiang Rai, Thailand

sources.snippet: The Clock Tower is probably the most famous attraction in the old town of Chiang Rai. This work of art was designed by Thai artist Chalermchai Khositpipat and opened in 2008 in honor of the king. Walking through the center, you almost always somehow pass the impressive golden bell tower of the city.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Chiang Rai (Thailand)

sources.snippet: The clock tower itself is extremely underwhelming during most of the day. While the structure itself is nice enough, it is sat in the middle of a busy intersection. However, there is a light show at night that is set to music and occurs at 7pm, 8pm and 9pm.
sources.shortName: üõï Chiang Rai Itinerary: 1-2 Perfect Days in Chiang Rai (2024)

sources.snippet: Clock Tower: Situated in the town center, this popular clock tower attracts tourists who love to take some photos with their loved ones here. In the evening, you can enjoy the music and laser lights show.
sources.shortName: 30 Places to Visit in Chiang Rai, Tourist Places & Attractions

places.name: Chiang Rai Clock Tower

reviews.text: You have to come here in the evening. Every  hour it's lights up in colours and playing Thai music for about  5 minutes. Very beautiful scene to watch. Enjoy
Beautiful clock tower at city center. Not much to do at this tower. Just take pictures and leave. It's walking distance to night market and some great cafes and spas.

The Chiang Rai Clock Tower is a truly captivating sight, especially in the evening when it comes alive with a beautiful light and sound show. Its intricate golden design is a testament to Thai craftsmanship and art. Located in the center of town, it's easy to visit and well worth a stop-whether you're passing through or spending time exploring Chiang Rai. The light shows at 7, 8, and 9 PM are particularly magical and not to be missed.

places.address: WR4J+V94 ‡∏™‡∏∏‡∏Ç‡∏™‡∏ñ‡∏¥‡∏ï, Tambon Wiang, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Doy Din Dang Pottery ‡πÄ‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏∑‡πà‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏õ‡∏±‡πâ‡∏ô‡∏î‡∏¥‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏ú‡∏≤‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏¢‡∏î‡∏¥‡∏ô‡πÅ‡∏î‡∏á is a pottery studio and gallery located on the outskirts of Chiang Rai, Thailand. The renowned Thai potter, Somluk Pantiboon, combines his international training with a local touch to create practical and decorative ceramics using natural glazes made from rice, bamboo, ash, and wood.

sources.snippet: Bring out your creative side at Doi Din Dang Pottery and design some creative items when you are in Chiang Rai. One of the most exciting places to visit in Chiang Rai, this place is surrounded by the most serene landscape and allows you to channel your artistic energies.
sources.shortName: 30 Places to Visit in Chiang Rai, Tourist Places & Attractions

places.name: Doy Din Dang Pottery ‡πÄ‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏∑‡πà‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏õ‡∏±‡πâ‡∏ô‡∏î‡∏¥‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏ú‡∏≤‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏¢‡∏î‡∏¥‡∏ô‡πÅ‡∏î‡∏á

reviews.text:
I loved this place. It was such a peaceful serene place remind me of hiking in the forest in Japan and come across structure that sells things. Also I came during the wettest part of monsoon season and the drizzle makes the place even more airy tale like. Not many places can claim their are being artsy and earthy at the same time and Doy Din Dang Pottery is exactly that.

Their coffee shop was super cute. I loved the fact that they serve drinks and a place for the customers to enjoy and soaked in the environment we are in far from the hustle and bustle  of the crowds.

Since it was a very quiet day, I was fortunate to be able to spend sometime there for a production tour and met the owner whose works were displayed for his customer to enjoy.

They do custom work for small batch and big batch productions for hospitality industry yet plenty of the work was one of a kind. Their pottery products range from small tea cup to human size vases.

The service was phenomenal. They boxed my stuff with all the padding necessary and secured with industrial packing tape with handle. All ready to be checked in. It was so convenient.

This is such a beautiful place to visit! If you love pottery, you will want to buy all the beautiful things available but it's also just a really nice serene spot to have a coffee and admire the buildings and stunning ceramic work.
The artist also built his own house on the property which is private but worth reading about in the book at the coffee shop.

This was such a quiet and lovely place, love it! If you ask me how it looks like, I can say this was so artsy yet earthy. There are lots of pottery works displays, place beautifully. Therefore, you need to be careful with your stuff and step!

There is also a coffee shop, sadly I didnt have the chance to tried their food and beverages. But its good knowing there's a place who serves art and silence in the crowded surroundings.

When I went there, there wasn't much visitors so I was able to watch how the workers make the pottery.

places.address: 2V8J+WRX, Nang Lae, Mueang Chiang Rai District, Chiang Rai 57100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Baan Dam Museum, also known as the Black House, is a unique collection of wood buildings showcasing the artworks of Thawan Duchanee and other contemporary Thai artists. Situated in Chiang Rai, it is part of a day tour that includes visits to prominent temples such as the White Temple (Wat Rong Khun) and the Blue Temple (Wat Rong Sueur Ten). The museum offers an intriguing experience with its dark-themed architecture and displays.

sources.shortName: 10 Best Photo Spots in Chiang Rai, Thailand

sources.snippet: Baan Da, or the Black House, is commonly mistaken for a temple. It is designed by the artist Thawan Duchanee and is actually more of a museum. The grounds consist of 40 different buildings, although not all are publicly accessible, each filled with an eclectic mix of art.  It has been described as dark and sombre, and I would advise looking into it further to decide if it‚Äôs a place you‚Äôll enjoy.
sources.shortName: üõï Chiang Rai Itinerary: 1-2 Perfect Days in Chiang Rai (2024)

sources.snippet: Enjoy an interesting excursion with a visit to Baan Dam Museum in Chiang Rai. One of the most fascinating places to visit in Chiang Rai, Baan Dam Museum often conceived as Thawan Duchanee‚Äôs creative portrayal of what hell would look like. It comprises of a temple that houses a collection of skins, bones, teeth, and taxidermy of a range array of animals.
sources.shortName: 30 Places to Visit in Chiang Rai, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: With over 40 interesting and impressive structures, the Baan Dam Museum is often mistaken for a temple and is definitely worth visiting if you‚Äôre in Chiang Rai. Designed by Thai artist Thawan Duchanee, the displays are an intriguing mix of traditional and contemporary styles, with many of them being provocative yet thought-provoking.
sources.shortName: Best Things to do in Chiang Rai, Thailand (+Photos)

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre planning to stay more than a day in Chiang Rai, be sure to add the Baan Dam Museum to your itinerary. More commonly known as the Black House, this masterpiece by famed Thai artist Thawan Duchanee is a must-visit for any art lover.
sources.shortName: Chiang Rai In Thailand |

sources.snippet: The area is home to pristine mountain villages, the beautiful Mekong River, as well as the world-famous White Temple (Wat Rong Khun) and Black Temple (Baan Dam).
sources.shortName: Chiang Rai Pictures - Chiang Rai Travel Photos

sources.snippet: Baan Dam Museum, also called ‚ÄúBlack House Museum‚Äù or ‚ÄúBlack Temple‚Äù is for sure among Chiang Rai‚Äôs most famous points of interest
sources.shortName: 17 Best Things to do in Chiang Rai | + My best tips

places.name: Baan Dam Museum

reviews.text:
Great place for people looking for something different! I first came here ten plus years ago and the artist's work made a deep impression on me. His paintings exude strong strokes, and seeing paintings was worth the trip alone. Original paintings can be seen in the galleries next to the parking lot. The main structure on the museum grounds contains prints. One thing that stands out is the artist's prolific collection of things. Some interesting buildings on the grounds, one of which is reminiscent of a traditional house in Sulawesi (also some statues that looked Balinese in origin). Everything is visually engaging, definitely not a typical Thai attraction. There are artisans in the back building wood working, which was great to see as well.

One staff said before COVID the museum would receive two to three thousand guests per day, but now visitors number around 500 per day. There are plenty of tourists here but it doesn't feel overcrowded. Well worth the visit.

The Ban Dam Museum, also known as the Black House, was a fascinating and unique experience. The blend of traditional Thai architecture with dark, unconventional art created a powerful atmosphere. Walking through the various buildings filled with animal bones, striking sculptures, and eerie furniture gave us a strange, almost haunting feeling-like stepping into someone's deep, mysterious imagination. It wasn't your typical museum; it challenged us to think and feel. A must-visit if you enjoy art that's bold, thought-provoking, and a little unsettling and strange. felt bad about cats in little cages

I am happy that I visited this museum. There is a bit of an occult atmosphere. With all these skulls and strange but beautiful sculptures.
The black buildings on the premises are very nice.
Worth the visit.

sources.shortName: 10 Best Photo Spots in Chiang Rai, Thailand

places.name: Lalitta Caf√©

reviews.text:
A caf√© is truly breathtaking, like a fairytale come true. This enchanting haven is filled with lush trees, vibrant shrubs and misty surroundings. The artificial mist adds an extra layer of magic to this captivating setting. Furthermore, this caf√© proudly features its own mesmerizing waterfall. A must-visit destination in Chiang Rai that will leave you inspired.
The entry fee is 60thb, which also entitles you to a discount on food.

Lalitta Caf√© isn't just a caf√©-it's an immersive escape. Hidden amid Chiang Rai's tranquil landscape, this caf√© feels like stepping into a scene from Avatar, complete with indoor waterfalls, misty air, and towering, nature-inspired structures that make you feel like you've been transported to another world.

The interior is stunning-lush greenery, water features, and fantasy-like architecture create a rainforest-meets-fairy-tale setting. It's easily one of the most photogenic spots in Chiang Rai, perfect for those looking to blend nature, fantasy, and a great photo op.

Service-hot dishes can take 30 to 45 minutes to arrive. However, drinks and desserts come out quickly, making it easy to settle in and enjoy the surroundings.

The chocolate cake, in particular, stands out: rich, spongy, and almost pudding-like in texture. It's indulgent and comforting-absolutely worth trying if you have a sweet tooth like me.

Whether you're looking to relax, explore, or snap some standout photos, it's a magical stop that adds something unique to any Chiang Rai itinerary.
